quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Amerigo Vespucci and Actress
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What French actress and model made her film debut in Bernardo Bertoluccis controversial film, The Dreamers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eva Green

questions.question: Amerigo Vespuccis third voyage was commanded by Goncalo Coelho in the service of which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portugal

questions.question: What French actress won a Best Actress Academy Award for her portrayal of famous singer Edith Piaf in La Vie En Rose?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marion Cotillard

questions.question: This French actress played a French literature teacher in the movie Skirt Day, a vengeful woman in One Deadly Summer and the French Queen Margaret of Valois. She received Cesar Awards for all these roles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isabelle Adjani

questions.question: On his second voyage in 1499 - 1500 Amerigo Vespucci joined an expedition with what other famous explorer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alonso de Ojeda

questions.question: This sex symbol of the 1960s came into the public spotlight with the movie And God Created Woman in which she plays a sensual 18-year old orphan challenging small-town morals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brigitte Bardot

questions.question: In 1508 Amerigo Vespucci was a chief of navigation of voyages to the Indies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Fernando Magellan was the first to create a world map and to name the newly discovered continent America after Amerigo Vespucci.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What French actress starred in Louis Malles films Elevator to the Gallows and The Lovers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jeanne Moreau

questions.question: Who published the book “Four Voyages of Amerigo Vespucci” in Latin translation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Waldseemuller

questions.question: This renowned French actress played enigmatic and mysterious beauties in the movies Repulsion and Belle de Jour.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catherine Deneuve

questions.question: Which famous ruler and politician whose death marked the end of Golden Age of Florence did explorer Amerigo Vespucci work for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lorenzo de Medici

questions.question: Amerigo Vespucci died on February 22, 1512 on the newly discovered continent of South America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This French actress gained international fame with her performances in Braveheart and the James Bond movie The World Is Not Enough.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sophie Marceau

questions.question: This French actress said that starring in Bernardo Bertoluccis movie Last Tango in Paris was her lifes only regret.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maria Schneider

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Che Guevara and John Rockefeller

questions.question: Which of the following women was married to John D. Rockefeller?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Laura Celestia Spelman

questions.question: What were Che Guevara’s last words according to popular belief?

options.text: ‘Shoot, coward, you are only going to kill a man.’
‘This is not the end, mark my words.’

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘Shoot, coward, you are only going to kill a man.’

questions.question: In what country was Che Guevara born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Argentina

questions.question: John D. Rockefeller fought in the American Civil War.

questions.question: The Maryland Institute College of Art gave Che Guevara’s photo this title.

options.text: Most inspiring photograph of the century
Most iconic photograph in the world
Most famous photograph in the world

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Most famous photograph in the world

questions.question: What is the name of the narrative written by Che Guevara as an account of his journey to Latin America?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rockefeller Foundation

questions.question: Che Guevara suffered from this medical condition throughout his life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asthma

questions.question: The Standard Oil Company was founded by John D. Rockefeller after which war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American Civil War

questions.question: John D. Rockefeller and Laura Celestia Cettie Spelman had four daughters and one son together.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Pirates and Bottle
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On 4 April 2009 the French yacht Tanit was captured by pirates and all five people, including a 3-year-old child, were taken hostages. What was the outcome?

options.text: The French forces rescued four of the hostages,including the child, and the fifth one was killed.
The French forces rescued the people, but the child was killed.
The pirates demanded a ransom, and the hostages were released after they got the money.
The hostages managed to free themselves.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The French forces rescued four of the hostages,including the child, and the fifth one was killed.

questions.question: This American-born French actor played Connor MacLeod in the Highlander film series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christophe Lambert

questions.question: On 8 April 2009 about 400 miles (640 km) east of Mogadishu, the Danish owned cargo ship MV Maersk Alabama was captured by pirates. What was the nationality of the whole crew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American

questions.question: In The Police song Message in a Bottle, a castaway on an island sends out a message in a bottle to seek love. What does he find on the shore a year later?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a hundred billion bottles

questions.question: Somali pirates were known for getting their weaponry from this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yemen

questions.question: What predominant type of weapons was used by the Somali pirates?

options.text: Semi-automatic pistols such as the TT-30

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: When did the UN Security Council adopt a resolution allowing international land and sea occupations in the pursuit of pirates?

options.text: Such a resolution can never be approved by Somalia.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On December 17, 2008

questions.question: The 2008 book Love Letters of Great Men plays a key role in the plot of this movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sex and the City

questions.question: On January 1, 2009 Somali pirates hijacked the Egyptian cargo ship Blue Star with 28 crew aboard. What kind of ransom did the pirates demand?

options.text: They demanded the release of a fellow-pirate that was captured earlier.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: US$ 1,000,000

questions.question: In the movie Message in a Bottle, what is the occupation of Theresa Osborne, who becomes fascinated by a mysterious, intriguing love letter, found in a bottle in the sand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: researcher for a major newspaper

questions.question: What was the name of the anti-piracy campaign of the European Union that started on 2 January 2009 with the capturing of eight Somali pirates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Operation Atlanta

questions.question: According to a BBC report, most of the Somali pirates fall into this category.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of this

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the Somali pirates in general?

options.text: Most of them were young, around 20-35 years old.
Most of them came from Puntland, a region in northeastern Somalia.
There were at least five pirate gangs and a total of 1,000 armed men.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: On 28 January 2009, Japan announced its intention of sending a naval task force to support the international forces fighting against Somalian piracy. Why was this decision unusual for Japan?

options.text: The constitution of Japan allows the use of the military forces only for defence.
Japan and Somalia had a Peace agreement.
The Japanese military is very small.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The constitution of Japan allows the use of the military forces only for defence.

questions.question: He played the villainous Sir Hugo Drax in the James Bond film, Moonraker and French detective Lebel in The Day of the Jackal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Lonsdale
